questions.question: 1. The unit weight of dry soil is greater than the unit weight of wet soil.

explanations.a: The presence of some water content adds to the weight of the soil with minimal change in volume.

questions.question: 2. The unit weight of soil decreases due to submergence of water.

explanations.b: When soil is submerged under water, a buoyant force acts on the soil leading to a decrease in the net weight of the soil and a consequent decrease in the unit weight.

questions.question: 3. A soil has a bulk density of 22 kN/m<sup>3</sup> and a dry density of 20 kN/m<sup>3</sup>. Determine the water content of the soil.

explanations.a: It is a direct application of the dry density formula. Simply solve for water content instead of dry density. The rearranged equation will be: Water content, w = (wet density(γ<sub>t</sub>) - dry density(γ<sub>d</sub>)) / dry density(γ<sub>d</sub>).
explanations.c: It is a direct application of the dry density formula. Simply solve for water content instead of dry density. The rearranged equation will be: Water content, w = (wet density(γ<sub>t</sub>) - dry density(γ<sub>d</sub>)) / dry density(γ<sub>d</sub>).
explanations.d: It is a direct application of the dry density formula. Simply solve for water content instead of dry density. The rearranged equation will be: Water content, w = (wet density(γ<sub>t</sub>) - dry density(γ<sub>d</sub>)) / dry density(γ<sub>d</sub>).

questions.question: 4. If the soil sample has a porosity of 30% and a specific gravity of solids, G = 2.7, then its dry unit weight will be ____

explanations.a: First we must find the voids ratio as e = n / (1 - n) where n is the porosity. Then we can find the dry unit weight using the formula γ<sub>d</sub> = G * γ<sub>w</sub> / (1 + e) where we assume γ<sub>w</sub> = g = 9.81 due to the question being on unit weight.
